messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] mosquitos, was; Respect and baths

messages.messageBody:
I looked up a few sites on Mosquitos.

From what I understood only female's bite. They bite to aid in increasing
their egg production. One site said that they are attracted by CO2 and can
sense your breath as far as 100 feet away.

I am sure most know but if you try to eliminate all the standing water in
your yard that may help cut down on the numbers of them.


Laura D

www.whimsicaltoys.com


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: mosquitos, was; Respect and baths
messages.messageBody:
<< And one benefit you can tell him is that the bugs

find you less attractive also. They would always attack the one that

smelled

like soap, deodorant or perfume. LOL >>



<< Well no wonder my kids and me getting eaten alive from the mosquitoes

here!!!!! Actually Joseph and my husband don't get bit, just me and the

girls. Seems like they are partial to females because Joseph and Joe shower

every day too. >>

I think mosquitos bite because of the kind of blood one has. A particular
thing that's in it (or maybe that's *not* in it). Not the cleanliness of the
skin. I never (never have) get bitten, my dh gets attacked. (We both shower a few
times a week, usually together <g>.) Lara.......
